result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Harold Hardyman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jeremy Harold Hardyman
Current: RUMS,   (Effective: 04-03-2017)
Prior: 800 13th Avenue, #229, Monroe, WI 53566

Jeremy Harold Hardyman, defendant appeared in Court in custody with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Repeater allegation stricken from the charge.  Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1 and directs a judgment of conviction be entered. Mr Luhman heard as to sentencing reccomendation.  Time served reccomended. Attorney Taylor joins in the reccomendation. Attorney Taylor request the Court waive court cost in this matter. Court waives the DNA surcharge and orders the balance of cost be paid 30 after release.
